item.title: Antimicrobial activity and phytochemical fingerprints of five crude extracts obtained from indigenous medicinal plants of Uganda
item.description: Five crude extracts from four Ugandan plants were screened in vitro for their antimicrobial activity and phytochemical composition. item.title: Evaluation of the in vivo anti malarial activity of the methanolic leaf extract of Nepata cateria
item.description: Nepata cateria (Labiatae) growing widely in northern Nigeria is used by most indigenes for the treatment of malaria and other related diseases. The in vivo anti-malarial activity of the methanol leaf extract was evaluated in mice infected with the chloroquine sensitive Plasmodium berghei berghei NK65 strain.
